intro: Scrophularia chlorantha, commonly known as the green scrophularia, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Plantaginaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, blooming from late spring to early summer. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland edges and meadows. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
